title: List of tested softphones
description:
Below is a list of of available Softphones that have been tested and extensively used with the Sippy Softswitch:

Windows 2000/XP, Mac OS X

(download)


Website – https://www.3cx.com (How to setup)

Windows, Linux, MAC OS X, IOS, Android

(download)


Microsip (How to setup)
Windows XP/Vista/Windows 7

(download)


eyeBeam
Windows 2000/XP/Vista, Mac OS X

(download)

Windows, Linux

(download)

Windows 98/ME/2000/XP/2003/Vista, Mac OS X

(download)

Windows

(download)

(download)

(download)

title: SJPhone Configuration for SSP (obsolete)
description:
Use of Proprietary Information and Copyright Notice. This document contains proprietary information that is to be used only by the Sippy Software, Inc. customers. Any unauthorized disclosure, copying, distribution, or use of this information is prohibited. (c) 2006 Sippy Software, Inc. All rights reserved.


1. Install the application

2. Start the application.

3. Go through audio tuning wizard.

4. Click on the Options button.




5. In the Options window select Profiles tab.



6. Push New button.



7. Enter some descriptive profile name and click OK.



8. In the Profile Options window select SIP Proxy tab. Enter DNS name of your SIP proxy into Proxy domain field and the same name into User domain. Uncheck Unregister contact address only checkbox and push OK button to close Profile Options window.




9. In the Service window enter SIP account details: account's VoIP Login into Account field and VoIP Password into Password field. Push OK button to close Service window.




10. Push OK to close Options window.



11. The status text in the SJPhone should change to "registered as ...". The phone is ready to make calls.



NOTE: May be malfunctioning in Microsoft Vista and above!
description_text:
Use of Proprietary Information and Copyright Notice.
 This document contains proprietary information that is to be used only 
by the Sippy Software, Inc. customers. Any unauthorized disclosure, 
copying, distribution, or use of this information is prohibited. (c) 
2006 Sippy Software, Inc. All rights reserved. 
 
 
   
 1. Install the application   
 2. Start the application.  
 3. Go through audio tuning wizard.  
 4. Click on the Options button. 
   
   
   
 5. In the Options window select Profiles tab.  
   
  
   
 6. Push New button.  
   
  
   
 7. Enter some descriptive profile name and click OK. 
   
  
   
 8. In the Profile Options window select SIP Proxy tab. Enter DNS 
name of your SIP proxy into Proxy domain field and the same name into 
User domain. Uncheck Unregister contact address only checkbox and push 
OK button to close Profile Options window. 
   
   
   
 9. In the Service window enter SIP account details: account's VoIP
 Login into Account field and VoIP Password into Password field. Push OK
 button to close Service window. 
   
   
   
 10. Push OK to close Options window.  
   
  
   
 11. The status text in the SJPhone should change to "registered as ...". The phone is ready to make calls.  
   
  
   
 NOTE: May be malfunctioning in Microsoft Vista and above!

title: X-Lite Configuration for NAT traversal
description:
1. Start X-Lite application.



2. Make a right click somewhere at the application display area. Select "SIP Account Settings..." item from the drop-down menu.



3. Select your active SIP profile, press "Properties" button.



4. Go to the "Topology" tab. Make sure "Use local IP address" and "Use specified server" options are selected and uncheck "Unable ICE" checkbox.




5. Go to the "Advanced" tab. Change "Reregister every" value to 300, make sure "Send SIP keep-alives" and "Use rport" checkboxes are checked.
description_text:
1. Start X-Lite application. 
   
  
   
 2. Make a right click somewhere at the application display area. Select "SIP Account Settings..." item from the drop-down menu.   
   
  
   
 3. Select your active SIP profile, press "Properties" button.   
   
  
   
 4. Go to the "Topology" tab. Make sure "Use local IP address" and "Use 
specified server" options are selected and uncheck "Unable ICE" 
checkbox.   
   
  
   
  
   
 5. Go to the "Advanced" tab. Change "Reregister every" value to 300, 
make sure "Send SIP keep-alives" and "Use rport" checkboxes are checked.

title: How to register account on the X-lite softphone.
description:
1. Login to the sippy web interface

2. Open Accounts menu and click to open account properties.



3. Open the X-lite softphone and click "Account settings".


4. In the opened window please add your account credentials.


Please specify the following:


Account Name (sippy side) = User ID (x-lite side)

Voip login (sippy side) = Auth. name (x-lite side)


Domain field - IP of your sippy environment or domain or you sippy environment where account is located.
description_text: 1. Login to the sippy web interface   2. Open Accounts menu and click to open account properties.          3. Open the X-lite softphone and click "Account settings".       4. In the opened window please add your account credentials.       Please specify the following:     Account Name (sippy side) = User ID (x-lite side)   Voip login (sippy side) = Auth. name (x-lite side)     Domain field - IP of your sippy environment or domain or you sippy environment where account is located.

title: Microsip
description:
MicroSIP - open source portable SIP softphone based on PJSIP stack for Windows OS.

It allowing to do high quality VoIP calls (person-to-person or on regular telephones) via open SIP protocol. From cloud of SIP providers you can choose best for you, register account and use it with MicroSIP. You'll get free person-to-person calls and cheap international calls.

Main in MicroSIP:

  • small footprint (>2.5MB) and RAM usage (>5MB) - written in C and C++ with minimal possible system resources usage
  • usability - user friendly in daily usage
  • functionality - voice; video H.264 and H.263+; SIMPLE messaging (RFC 3428) and presence (RFC 3903, 6665)
  • compatibility - strongly conform to SIP standards
  • voice quality - supports best voice codecs: speex@8,16,32kHz, iLBC@8kHz, GSM@8kHz, G.711@8kHz (PCMU and PCMA), G.722@16kHz, G.729@8kHz, SILK@8,12,16,24kHz, Linear PCM@8,16,44kHz
  • privacy - configurable encryption TLS / SRTP for control and media
  • portability - stores setting in ini file
  • multilanguage - included localization files for brazilian, bulgarian, chinese, dutch, estonian, finnish, french, german, hebrew, hungarian, italian, korean, norwegian, polish, russian (микросип), spanish, swedish, ukrainian, 


Few screenshots:
